{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3539049,"name":"Michael Blanton","username":"IAmBlanton","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/iamblanton/{size}/202102_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-25T04:43:31.513Z","cooked":"

Hello! We’re working on our elevator, using 2 neo brushless motors and sparkmax controllers. The elevator rises to the correct position, but then it starts sliding back down. The motors are in brake mode, and the power to the bot is still on, but the motors aren’t holding the elevator in it’s position. What are we missing?

The other oddity we’re noticing (although less of a problem), it seems to go to twice the rotations - we tell it to go to 10 and it goes to 20. But that one we can more easily solve.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":5,"updated_at":"2025-02-25T04:43:31.513Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":15,"reads":115,"readers_count":114,"score":98.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":493093,"topic_slug":"question-about-motor-control-on-our-elevator","display_username":"Michael Blanton","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":61068,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/question-about-motor-control-on-our-elevator/493093/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3539054,"name":"","username":"Alex_Y","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/82dd89/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-02-25T04:46:17.982Z","cooked":"

Brake mode does not hold anything in position, all it does is severely resist movement that already is happening by shorting a motor to itself. You want to be constantly running your feedback controller (preferably with gravity compensation) to maintain positions.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":5,"updated_at":"2025-02-25T04:46:17.982Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":110,"readers_count":109,"score":22.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":493093,"topic_slug":"question-about-motor-control-on-our-elevator","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":50219,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/question-about-motor-control-on-our-elevator/493093/2","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3539129,"name":"icemannie","username":"icemannie","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/i/bc79bd/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-02-25T11:04:46.126Z","cooked":"

ElevatorFeedforward has a gravity volt setting Kg to counteract what you are seeing.
Feedforward Control in WPILib — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation

You do need to keep the position loop closed at all times as the previous post indicated.
You can combine a Trapezoidal profile for smoother motion also.

We are using NEOs (brushless) - it looks like the elevatorfeedforward is for magnetic motors?

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":5,"updated_at":"2025-02-26T03:09:38.021Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":54,"readers_count":53,"score":15.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":493093,"topic_slug":"question-about-motor-control-on-our-elevator","display_username":"Michael Blanton","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":28240,"username":"icemannie","name":"icemannie","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/i/bc79bd/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":61068,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/question-about-motor-control-on-our-elevator/493093/4","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3540724,"name":"usbcd36","username":"usbcd36","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/usbcd36/{size}/2444_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-26T03:44:54.866Z","cooked":"

That is indeed what you want.

All FRC-legal motors have permanent magnets. The difference is brushless motors switch between which electromagnets are attracting/repelling those permanent magnets using transistors, and brushed motors do it with a special mechanical switch.
